Water samples can be stored at   for 1 week,   for 1 month, and   for longer periods of time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9428o","text":"2. Make sure the water inlet tube and Magnetic Filter Funnel and glass bottles  are properly clean and dry. If autoclave is not available, the parts in the filter system that directly contacted to the water samples needs to be fully rinsed by 10% bleach, followed by water and 70% ethanol then dry.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"501n8","text":"3. If the water samples were collected at a high temperature sampling site (≥ ) with visible floating plants, microalgae, and sediments, use   water sample for downstream filtration, otherwise, use   water sample for filtration.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":77,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":141,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":198,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3bc65","text":"4. If water sample is frozen, fully thaw it at   then process it when it is still cold.  When water sample frozen in a plastic sample bag, wipe the bag surface with 70% ethanol to remove dusts and  sanitize the surface. Place three bags of   water samples from the same sampling location in a new 1190 ml sterile sample bag, then put the bagged samples in a suitable-sized container for thawing. After samples are fully defrosted, pour the water samples into the 1190 ml outer bag, and discard the original 250 ml sample bags. Hold the whole bag in a 1 L beaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":241,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"879jr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9i0io","text":"5. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5v09","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7trih","text":"SUMMARY/SCOPE","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jceo","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"579bs","text":"The overarching aim of the REDI-NET is to develop a collaborative laboratory network between domestic and international partnering institutions to address disease surveillance needs in order to effectively detect, predict and contain potentially emergent zoonosis. This SOP provides guidance on procedures for total nucleic acid extraction from water samples to allow downstream library preparation and sequencing for pathogen detection. {"blocks":[{"key":"1s4qn","text":"Each water sample has 4 filter membranes from different filtrations (before PEG-8000 treatment: membrane of pore size 10 and 5, one of each; after PEG-8000 treatment: membrane of pore size 5 and 0.45, one of each)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jjbi","text":"Cut the membranes into 2 halves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6n4i5","text":"Use the forceps to stack the 2 half membranes, then fold the stacked halves into a smaller sector and  cut it ( smaller than 1 mm x 3 mm, see example in Figure 1) into the a tube prepared in step 40 (Suggest collecting the 2 half membranes before PEG-8000 in tube A and the 2 half membranes from after PEG-8000 treatment in tube B). A tube needs to be connected to the inner connector of the Screw Cap GL 45 with 2-hose connector for guide the filtrate to the bottom of the bottle to avoid the water entering the vacuum system (F). The disposable funnel comes with a 0.45 µm membrane and secures the filter membrane by snap on the filter holding stage. The 0.45 µm can be replaced by a 30, 10, or 5 µm membrane, the support pad under the membrane needs to be kept during the filtration (D).
